intro: Phania trinervia, commonly known as the Three-veined Phania, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and palmate leaves with three distinct veins. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a modest display of white or pale yellow petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
